story:
Chào con ơi! (Hello, son!)

Once upon a time, in a small village nestled in the rolling hills of Vietnam, there was a magical forest filled with towering trees, sparkling streams, and vibrant flowers. It was a place where ancient dragons and mythical creatures roamed free, and where magic was woven into the very fabric of the air.

In this forest, there lived a kind and gentle dragon named Long. Long was a curious and playful dragon, with scales that shimmered like the sun on the rice fields and wings that sparkled like the stars in the night sky. He loved nothing more than to explore the forest, discovering hidden waterfalls and secret glades, and making friends with all the creatures that lived there.

One day, while Long was out on one of his adventures, he stumbled upon a hidden clearing deep in the heart of the forest. In the center of the clearing stood an enormous ancient tree, its branches twisted and gnarled with age. Carved into the trunk of the tree was a series of intricate symbols, shimmering with a soft, ethereal light.

Long was fascinated by the symbols and decided to investigate further. As he touched the symbols with his scaly nose, the tree began to glow with a warm, golden light. The light grew brighter and brighter, until Long felt himself being lifted off the ground, high into the air.

Up, up, up he soared, above the treetops and into the sky, until he found himself facing a brilliant full moon hanging low in the horizon. The moon smiled down at Long, and its light enveloped him, filling him with a sense of peace and tranquility.

From the moon, a soft, melodious voice spoke to Long, saying, "You, kind and gentle dragon, have been chosen to receive a special gift. You have been given the power to spread joy and happiness to all the creatures of the forest, and to keep the magic of this enchanted land alive."

Long was overjoyed and vowed to use his newfound power to make the forest an even more wondrous and magical place. And so, he spent his days flitting from flower to flower, spreading pollen and seeds, and whispering secrets to the trees, awakening the forest to a whole new world of wonder and enchantment.

As the years passed, the forest grew more vibrant and thriving than ever before. The creatures of the forest flourished, and the magic of the forest grew stronger and more radiant. And Long, the gentle dragon, remained at the heart of it all, spreading joy and happiness to all who dwelled there.

And so, my dear son, I hope this story has transported you to a world of wonder and magic, where anything is possible and dreams come alive. Just like Long, the gentle dragon, may you too spread joy and happiness wherever you go, and may the magic of the forest remain alive in your heart forever.

Sweet dreams, con ơi. May the moon shine brightly on your path, and may your heart remain full of wonder and magic.
